metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5010 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the X509 certificate parser of Python.org Python 2.7.11 / 3.6.6. A specially crafted X509 certificate can cause a NULL pointer dereference, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker can initiate or accept TLS connections using crafted certificates to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-5010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7 - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.16-2
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.16-2
python2.7 - 2.7.16-2
python2.7-examples - 2.7.16-2
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.16-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> DoS is only possible in certain situations, see upstream bug report. Marking as low.

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.16-2').
